intro: Limonium pandatariae, commonly known as the Crimean sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Black Sea. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky coastal soils and is adapted to saline and windy environments. Its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit make it a hardy, low-maintenance plant. Limonium pandatariae is often used in coastal landscaping due to its resilience and ornamental value.
